meanings.definition: To receive and pass on (information or a message)
meanings.sent1: She relayed the news to her friend quickly.
meanings.sent2: He relayed the instructions to the team without delay.
meanings.sent3: The cat relayed the meow from the other room.
meanings.sent4: The relayed message traveled through the air like a bird.
meanings.sent5: The relayed information buzzed in her mind all day.

meanings.definition: To pass along (something received) to another
meanings.sent1: He relayed the package to the neighbor next door.
meanings.sent2: She relayed the compliment to her sister with a smile.
meanings.sent3: The dog relayed the ball back to its owner playfully.
meanings.sent4: The relayed gift brought joy to the recipient.
meanings.sent5: The relayed message traveled swiftly from one person to another.

meanings.definition: To broadcast or send out (a signal or message)
meanings.sent1: The radio station relayed the weather report to listeners.
meanings.sent2: They relayed the distress signal to the coast guard.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel relayed a warning to its fellow squirrels.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse relayed its beacon across the stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The relayed signal echoed through the valley.
